definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
layer filled with rammed earth in a tomb pit (archeology)
carrier who carries heavy loads on his shoulder (dialect)
variant of 心拙口笨[xin1 zhuo1 kou3 ben4]
to pound the earth to make a building foundation
in unison and with one voice (dialect)

sentences.english: The development of vibration plates has been highly eventful.
sentences.chinese: 振动式平板夯的发展已得到了高度的重视。

sentences.english: Always he sought someone to whom he could talk caution.
sentences.chinese: 他一直遮找踊个能夯随便透谈蹬人。

sentences.english: Acc-ording to the results of the experiment, the mechanism of forceful tamping on wetcollapsible loess is dealt with.
sentences.chinese: 根据试验的结果，探讨了湿陷性黄土的强夯机理。

sentences.english: Compacting effect is caused in forming process of ramming expanded piles.
sentences.chinese: 夯扩桩在成桩过程中会产生挤土效应。

sentences.english: These large structures were built by piling baskets of carefully selected earth on top of a mound of earth.
sentences.chinese: 在仔细选好的地面上夯坑，建造这些大结构建筑。

sentences.english: At last the foundation is consolidated by the heavy-tamping broken stone piers.
sentences.chinese: 最后选择了强夯碎石墩对基础进行复合地基加固。

sentences.english: The city wall of Xi'an was first built of earth, rammed layer upon layer.
sentences.chinese: 最初的西安城墙完全用黄土分层夯打而成。

sentences.english: Hammered by the plasticizer scandal, natural fruit juice becomes extremely popular, and the price of fruits continues to rise.
sentences.chinese: 受到塑化剂影响，天然果汁夯，水果价格也持续看涨。

sentences.english: The invention relates to a hammer ram used frequently in forging and construction field.
sentences.chinese: 一种在锻打及施工领域普遍采用的夯锤。

definition: rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc
an article made of bamboo strips/fence
to build by laying bricks or stones
(dialect) don't/must not/(contraction of 不 and 要)
